ediT2-haskell

RT.RT

Description

Module to generate .t2 file for the pattern Reciprocal Teaching.

Synopsis

  • data Info = Info {
    • objects :: PatternObjects
    • nbPPG :: Int
    • above :: Int
    • below :: Int
    • uniform :: Bool
    }
  • run :: [String] -> IO ()
  • generateLevels :: Info -> ([Level], PatternObjects)
  • generateActivityLvl :: Level
  • generateResourceLvl :: [Resource] -> Level
  • generateGroupLvl :: Int -> [String] -> Level
  • generateRoleLvl :: Int -> Level
  • generateParticipantLvl :: [Participant] -> [Int] -> Int -> Level
  • roundRobin :: Int -> [[Participant]] -> [[[Participant]]]
  • turn :: [[Participant]] -> [[Participant]]
  • createGroups :: Int -> [String]
  • repartitionParticipant :: Int -> Int -> Int -> Int -> Bool -> Possible [Int]

Documentation

data Info Source

Constructors

Info

Info, contain information needed for the pattern.

Fields

objects :: PatternObjects

Pattern's objects.

nbPPG :: Int

Number of participants per group preferred.

above :: Int

Above margin.

below :: Int

Below margin.

uniform :: Bool

Uniform repartition over closest one, if True.

Instances

Read Info 

run :: [String] -> IO ()Source

run, entry point. Expect a file path in argument pointing to a file containing information needed.

generateLevelsSource

Arguments

:: Info

Information for the pattern.

-> ([Level], PatternObjects)
Level
= list of levels, PatternObjects = pattern objects.

generateLevels, generatee the levels for the tree.

:: [Participant]

List of participants.

-> [Int]

Repartition of participants for the learning activity.

-> Int

-> Level

Participant's level.

generateParticipantLvl, generate the participant level.

roundRobinSource

Arguments

:: Int

Number of time that it must turns the list (= number of passages = number of resources).

-> [[Participant]]

Lists of participants already splitted in groups.

-> [[[Participant]]]

The part of the participant's level for the learning activity.

roundRobin, create the part of the participant's level for the learning activity. It turns the list of participants for each group, and take the first participant apart to be the teacher.

turn :: [[Participant]] -> [[Participant]]Source

turn, put the last participant of each group in the first place.

createGroupsSource

Arguments

:: Int

Number of groups.

-> [String]

List of groups.

createGroups, create groups for the learning level.

repartitionParticipantSource

Arguments

:: Int

Number of participants.

-> Int

Number of participants per group wanted.

-> Int

Above margin.

-> Int

Below margin.

-> Bool

If the user prefers a uniform repartition or a closest repartition.

-> Possible [Int]

Possible size's repartition.

repartitionParticipant, size repartition for groups of the learning level.
